intro: Hieracium glaucochroum, commonly known as the bluish hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring well-drained, sunny conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a bluish tinge, giving it its common name. Hieracium glaucochroum is often considered a weed but can play a role in supporting local pollinators.
